column4: Hi, I'm in bitchx in tty1 and need serious help. When I type the correct login information in the loginscreen, gdm restarts. And I return to the login scren.  What should I do?!
I'm not running ubuntu right now so I'm not the best person to help, but I think the first thing to try is to check the X log files to see what the error is
but X must be working since it is able to show the login..?
or you can just type startx and I think the errors will be displayed on the screen (you can do that on a diff console so you don't have to close bitchx)
good point. Well, if startx works then you know it's a gdm problem. If it doesn't, then it's probably a X problem
did you change your .xinit file recently?
ok. Too bad, that would be a good candidate for the breakage ;)
try startx, let us know what that does
okay! Start X prob. gave me the error
it cant write to /var. Its full..?
df -h will show free space. If var's full, then it would make sense that you can't login
thanks ;) Trying to free some space by removing amarok
glad I was able to help! And thanks for letting me know you  figured it out :)
